oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - The Family of Loretta Lynn - 2017-08-26
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Panel discussion titled We Are Family: The Kin of Loretta Lynn from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on August 26, 2017. Participants include Crystal Gayle, Peggy Sue Wright, Patsy Lynn Russell, Emily Rose Russell and Tayla Lynn. Discussion moderated by Michael McCall. Includes excerpted recorded audio, audio from video and performances. In support of the exhibition Loretta Lynn: Blue Kentucky Girl.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Crystal Gayle; Peggy Sue Wright; Patsy Lynn Russell; Emily Rose Russell; Tayla Lynn;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (04:39) Opening announcements from Abi Tapia / (05:22) Walk-in music continues / (07:18) Opening comments and participant introduction from Michael McCall / (11:43) Applause and opening comments / (12:56) Audio excerpt from video / (13:55) Comments about Loretta being herself / (14:47) Emily recalls her earliest memory of Loretta / (15:20) Tayla recalls her earliest memory of Loretta / (16:06) Patsy recalls her earliest memory of Loretta / (17:44) Crystal recalls her earliest memory of Loretta and their trip to Washington State together / (21:40) Crystal recalls her impressions of Mooney / (22:53) Crystal talks about leaving Butcher Hollow at 4 years old / (23:23) Peggy Sue talks about Butcher Hollow and the early days of Loretta and Mooney / (25:18) Patsy talks about older kids taking care of younger kids / (26:14) Peggy Sue talks about her feelings when Loretta left home / (27:33) Emily Rose comments on a picture being shown to the audience /

(28:40) Peggy Sue talks about when she discovered that Loretta had a career as a singer / (29:50) Peggy Sue talks about starting her career as a singer / (30:52) Crystal talks about her inspiration to become a singer and Jay Lee Webb's help / (34:48) Tayla performs Honky Tonk Girl (Jason Howard- guitar and vocal) / (37:11) Tayla talks about recording the song and Patsy talks about working on the road with Loretta and the luck of being in a musical family / (38:58) Patsy talks about the family living in Wabash, Indiana / (40:44) Peggy Sue talks about beginning to write songs and writing Don't Come Home A'Drinkin' / (45:31) Peggy Sue performs Don't Come Home A'Drinkin' / (48:06) Peggy Sue talks about writing from her experiences / 49:30) Patsy talks about the song Coal Miner's Daughter and the book of the same name / (51:03) Emily comments on the history of her family / (51:52) Patsy talks about Loretta writing from experience and the song Marijuana /
